-e ---

󲂥 󲉬 󲂣 󲂤 only as logograph in cretan ≠ 󲀌 󲀋 𐘩 NWA 𓂜 no never nix
𐀛 ni 𐃓
𐘝 NI νικύλεον nikuleon ≈ نَخْلَة naḵla "date palm" "date, fig"
𜎜 NU

νικύλεον· τὸ σῦκον ἐν ταῖς Κρητικαῖς γλώσσαις (attributed to Hermonax in Athenaeus Deipnosophistae 76e).

In other words, Hermonax’s νικύλεον and the use of ni as the ideogram for fig in Linear B very likely are derived from this Minoan word.

bu.νικύ φοῖνῐξ phonix "date palm"
